techmeme.title: Salesforce buys Doti AI for $100M; the Israeli startup raised $7M and its Work AI tool lets enterprises securely access and use internal knowledge in real time (Meir Orbach/CTech)
OnePlus launches the $900+ OnePlus 15, with a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip and a 6.78" 165Hz display; the US launch is delayed due to the government shutdown (Chris Welch/Bloomberg)
Grayscale files for an IPO, reporting $203.3M in net income on $318.7M in revenue for January to September 2025; the DCG unit has ~$35B in AUM and 40+ products (Isabelle Lee/Bloomberg)
Google launches AI-powered shopping features in the US, including conversational search, side-by-side item comparisons, price tracking, and AI-assisted checkout (Mia Sato/The Verge)
Dresden-based chip startup Ferroelectric Memory raised €100M, including €77M equity led by HV Capital and DTCF, to commercialize energy-saving memory chips (Christina Kyriasoglou/Bloomberg)
